markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 5"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Aether Appendage](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2160)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Incorporeal" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=222" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 108 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Price** 160 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** worn

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This otherworldly prosthetic arm is the product of [psychopomp](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=458) magic. An _aether appendage_ is [incorporeal](/Traits.aspx?ID=632) so long as no item is being held in the hand or worn on the arm.

**Activate** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=561))    **Effect** You cause the arm to become corporeal until the end of your turn, allowing you to use it to make Strikes or grasp objects. It remains corporeal if you’re holding an item or it’s wearing an item at the end of your turn. Your unarmed attack Strikes made with the aether appendage are [magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=644). If they’re already magical, they instead gain the effect of the [_ghost touch_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2840) property rune.

**Activate** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=561), [manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=645)) **Frequency** once per day;  **Requirements** You're holding a non-magical item of light or negligible Bulk; **Effect** The item becomes incorporeal for 1 minute. Your _aether appendage_ can use the incorporeal item normally.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Aether Appendage
